content: I admit I was at first surprised by the idea of combating political correctness with the election of a president, rather than, as a sensible person might do, by sharing George Carlin videos. One might militate against liberal pieties by writing a book or pitching an edgy TV show — effective measures that don’t simultaneously empower a chief executive who could revoke health care from millions, spark a recession, degrade the lives of brown citizens and Muslims, trash the environment, bomb more countries, disrupt stabilizing alliances, imprison more minor drug offenders, and jeopardize access to reproductive care. It strikes me as a desperately incomplete political vision to throw these matters into chaos to just gain pushback against sensitive broadcasters and college students.
